alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 3:24AM CDT until April 01 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MARION...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE AND CENTRAL LAMAR COUNTIES... At 324 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Eldridge to near Bluff to near Caledonia, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Vernon, Sulligent, Guin, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Beaverton, Gu- Win, Bluff, Blooming Grove, Lamar County Airport, Bedford, Bankston, Crossville, Twin, Tucker, Cody, Wayside and Richard Arthur Field. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northwestern and west central Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
